text: Against Pledges
My child, if you have pledged to your neighbor,
\add if\add* you have bound ⸤yourself⸥\f + \fr 6:1 \ft Literally “palms of your hands” \f* to the stranger,
\add if\add* you are snared by the sayings of your mouth,
\add if\add* you are caught by the sayings of your mouth,
do this, then, my child, and save yourself,
for you have come into ⸤the palm of your neighbor’s hand⸥:\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Literally “the palm of the hand of your neighbor” \f*
Go, humble yourself, plead with your neighbor.
Do not give sleep to your eyes,
or slumber to your eyelids.
Save yourself like a gazelle from a hand,
or like a bird from the hand of a fowler.
Against Sloth
Go to the ant, lazy!
Consider its ways and be wise.
It has no chief,
officer, or ruler.
In the summer, it prepares its food;
in the harvest, it gathers its sustenance.
How long will you lie down, lazy?
When will you rise up from your sleep?
A little sleep, a little slumber,
a little folding of the hands for rest—
like a ⸤robber⸥\f + \fr 6:11 \ft Literally “one who walks,” that is, a vagabond \f* shall your poverty come,
and what you lack like an armed man.
Against Worthlessness
A worthless man, an evil man,
goes around with ⸤deceitful speech⸥.\f + \fr 6:12 \ft Literally “crookedness of mouth” \f*
Winking in his eye, shuffling in his foot,
pointing in his fingers,
perversion in his heart, he devises evil;
at all times he will send out discord.\f + \fr 6:14 \ft Or “quarrels” \f*
Upon ⸤such a man⸥,\f + \fr 6:15 \ft Literally “thus” \f* suddenly shall his calamity come;
in a moment he will be damaged and there is no healing.\f + \fr 6:15 \ft Or “repair” \f*
What Yahweh Hates
There are six \add things\add* Yahweh hates,
and seven \add things are\add* abominations of his soul:\f + \fr 6:16 \ft Or “inner self” \f*
haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
and hands that shed innocent blood,
a devising heart, plans of deception,
feet that hurry to run to evil,\f + \fr 6:18 \ft Hebrew “the evil” \f*
a false witness who breathes lies
and sends out discord\f + \fr 6:19 \ft Or “quarrels” \f* between brothers.
Commandment and Instruction as Guardians
My child, keep \add the\add* commandment of your father,
and do not disregard \add the\add* instruction of your mother.
Bind them on your heart continually;
tie them upon your neck.
⸤When you walk⸥,\f + \fr 6:22 \ft Literally “In your walking” \f* she\f + \fr 6:22 \ft That is, “commandment” and “instruction” \f* will lead you,
⸤When you lie down⸥,\f + \fr 6:22 \ft Literally “In your lying down” \f* she will watch over you,
and \add when\add* you awake, she will converse \add with\add* you.
For \add like\add* a lamp \add is\add* a commandment, and instruction \add is\add* light,
and the way of life\f + \fr 6:23 \ft Hebrew “lives” \f* \add is the\add* reproof of discipline,
\add in order\add* to preserve you from an evil woman,\f + \fr 6:24 \ft Or “wife” \f*
from the smoothness of \add the\add* tongue of ⸤an adulteress⸥.\f + \fr 6:24 \ft Literally “a foreign woman” \f*
Do not desire her beauty in your heart;
may she not capture you with her eyelashes.
For \add the\add* price of a woman, a prostitute,\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Or “whore” \f* \add is the\add* price of a loaf of bread,
but the ⸤woman belonging to a man⸥\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Literally “the woman of a man” \f* hunts precious life.
Warning Against Relations with a Married Woman
Can a man carry fire in his lap,
and his clothes not burn?
If a man walks upon the hot coals,
will his feet not be burned?
Thus, he who goes to the wife of his neighbor,
any who touches her shall not go unpunished.
\add People\add* do not despise a thief when he steals
to fill himself\f + \fr 6:30 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* when he is hungry.
But \add if\add* he is found, he will pay sevenfold,
every possession of his house he shall give.
He who commits adultery \add with\add* a woman lacks ⸤sense⸥,\f + \fr 6:32 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
he destroys himself\f + \fr 6:32 \ft Or “his soul,” or “his life” \f* who does it.
A wound and dishonor he will find,
and his disgrace will not be wiped out.
For jealousy \add is the\add* fury of a husband,
and he will not show restraint on the day of revenge.
He will not accept ⸤any compensation⸥,\f + \fr 6:35 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft face of any compensation” \f*
and he will not be willing, though the bribe is large.
